{{Infobox organisation |name = Tiatr Academy of Goa |image = |image_border = |size = <!-- default 200 --> |alt = <!-- alt text; see [[WP:ALT]] --> |caption = |map = <!-- optional --> |msize = |malt = <!-- map alt text --> |mcaption = |abbreviation = TAG |motto = |formation = {{Start date and years ago|2009|01|16}} |extinction = <!-- date of extinction, optional --> |type = [[Governmental organization]] |status = <!-- ad hoc, treaty, foundation, etc --> |purpose = Foster and develop Tiatr and its dances, music, songs and literature; especially the Konkani Literature in Roman script as well as through them the cultural unity of Goa as well as India.<ref name="auto">{{cite web|url=https://www.goa.gov.in/department/tiatr-academy-of-goa/ |title=Government of Goa | Tiatr Academy of Goa |publisher=Goa.gov.in |date= |accessdate=2017-04-17}}</ref> |headquarters = Second floor, Campal Trade Centre, [[Panaji]], [[Goa]] |location = [[Panaji]], [[Goa]], [[India]] |coords = <!-- Coordinates of location using a coordinates template --> |region_served = |membership = |language = |leader_title = President<!-- position title for the leader of the org --> |leader_name = Agostinho Temudo<ref name="thegoan.net">{{cite web|url=http://englishnews.thegoan.net/story.php?id=3875|title=Tiatr Academy gets a new president|publisher=}}</ref> |main_organ = General Council<ref name="goa.gov.in">{{cite web|url=http://artandculture.goa.gov.in/content_item_disp.php|title=Directorate of Art and Culture - Official Govt of Goa Website - Goa Government|website=artandculture.goa.gov.in}}</ref> |parent_organisation = Directorate of Art & Culture, [[Government of Goa]]<ref name="goa.gov.in"/> |budget = |website = http://www.tiatracademygoa.com |remarks = }} The '''Taitr Academy of Goa''' is a government body established by the [[Government of Goa]] in 2009 during the tenure of [[Digambar Kamat]] as the [[Chief Minister of Goa]]. The Academy was inaugurated on 16 January 2009 in [[Margao]] at the hands of the [[tiatr]] artist ''Master'' Jose Francisco Vaz<ref>{{cite web|author=Nt Network |url=http://www.navhindtimes.com/story.php?story=2009021312 |title=Eminent Tiatrist Master Vaz to open Tiatr Academy on Feb 16: Navhindtimes.com, Goa |publisher=Navhindtimes.com |date=2009-02-13 |accessdate=2017-04-17}}</ref> The Academy's aim is to foster and develop [[Tiatr]] and its dances, music, songs and literature; especially the Konkani Literature in Roman script as well as through them the cultural unity of [[Goa]] as well as [[India]].<ref name="auto"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tiatracademygoa.com/Constitution%20of%20Tiatr%20Academy%20of%20Goa.html |title=Constitution - Aims, Activities & Objectives of the Tiatr (Konkani Drama Academy) of Goa, TAG |publisher=Tiatracademygoa.com |date=2009-02-02 |accessdate=2017-04-17}}</ref>
==History== The [[tiatr]] has a rich history<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.sahapedia.org/oxem-ghoddlem |title=Oxem Ghoddlem |publisher=Sahapedia |date= |accessdate=2017-04-17}}</ref> of 125 years<ref>{{cite web|author=Tiatr to complete 125 years since inception |url=http://www.navhindtimes.in/tiatr-to-complete-125-years-since-inception/ |title=Tiatr to complete 125 years since inception | The Navhind Times |publisher=Navhindtimes.in |date=2010-03-15 |accessdate=2017-04-17}}</ref> and is an important form of [[theatre]] in the [[Konkani language]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://indianexpress.com/article/lifestyle/the-medium-is-the-message-the-magic-of-tiatr-goas-traditional-konkani-theatre-form/ |title=The medium is the message: The magic of Tiatr, Goa’s traditional Konkani theatre form |publisher=The Indian Express |date=2014-10-05 |accessdate=2017-04-17}}</ref> The first [[tiatr]] was performed in 1892 in [[Bombay]].<ref>{{cite web|author=Bhavya Dore |url=https://scroll.in/article/805490/tiatr-goas-best-loved-theatre-form-is-getting-an-english-language-twist-from-a-veteran-director |title=Tiatr, Goa’s best-loved theatre form, is getting an English-language twist from a veteran director |publisher=Scroll.in |date= |accessdate=2017-04-17}}</ref>
There had been a demand from lovers of [[tiatr]] and the artists that the [[Government of Goa]] take steps to protect and promote the [[theatre]] form.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tiatracademygoa.com/slides/2a.html |title=2 |publisher=Tiatracademygoa.com |date= |accessdate=2017-04-17}}</ref> During the tenure of [[Digambar Kamat]] as the [[Chief Minister of Goa]], a committee was established under [[Chief Minister]] [[Digambar Kamat|Kamat]]'s chairmanship for the purpose of drafting a [[constitution]] for the proposed [[Tiatr]] Academy. The committee included [[Tomazinho Cardozo]], Premanand Sangodkar, Fatima D'Souza, Wilson Mazarello, [[Prince Jacob]] and Prasad Lolayekar (Director, Directorate of Art & Culture of the [[Government of Goa]]) as members.<ref name="auto1">{{cite web|url=http://www.tiatracademygoa.com/slides/3a.html |title=3 |publisher=Tiatracademygoa.com |date= |accessdate=2017-04-17}}</ref> The committee drafted the [[constitution]] and the Academy was registered under the [[Societies Registration Act, 1860]] under No. 85/[[Goa]]/2009 on 2 February 2009.<ref name="auto1"/> The [[Government of Goa]] appointed [[Tomazinho Cardozo]] as the first President<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.heraldgoa.in/The-Sunday-Roundtable/The-Sunday-Roundtable/tomazinho-is-chief-of-tiatr-academy-/21221.html |title=Herald: Tomazinho is chief of Tiatr academy |publisher=Heraldgoa.in |date=2009-01-08 |accessdate=2017-04-17}}</ref> of the Academy and the Academy was inaugurated on 16 January 2009.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.heraldgoa.in/Goa/The-Sunday-Roundtable/muchawaited-goa-tiatr-academy-opens-today/23275.html |title=Herald: Much-awaited Goa Tiatr Academy opens today |publisher=Heraldgoa.in |date=2009-02-16 |accessdate=2017-04-17}}</ref>
==Administration== The General Council and the President of the Tiatr Academy of Goa are appointed by the [[Government of Goa]] for a term of three years. In addition to [[ex officio members]] like the Secretary and the Directror of Art & Culture, [[Government of Goa]]; the Council also other members and organisations who work in the field of [[tiatr]]. The term of the General Council shall be three years.<ref>http://www.tiatracademygoa.com/Constitution%20of%20Tiatr%20Academy%20of%20Goa.html</ref><ref>http://www.tiatracademygoa.com/Committee%20of%20Tiatr%20Academy%20of%20Goa.html</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://goacom.com/tiatr-academy-of-goa-completes-its-councils/?page_number_1=1|title=Tiatr Academy of Goa completes its Councils - GOACOM - GOA - INDIA - INFORMATION AND SERVICES IN GOA. Goa News, Goa Konkani News, Goa Sunaparant News, Goan Konakani News, Goa Video News, Goa Yellow Pages|website=goacom.com}}</ref>
==Activities== The Academy organises various programmes and events for the promotion and conservation of [[tiatr]]. The Academy organises competitions and festivals such as the Children's [[Tiatr]] Festival<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.heraldgoa.in/Goa/%E2%80%98Gorjechem%E2%80%99-tops-at-6th-Children%E2%80%99s-Tiatr-Festival/97268.html |title=Herald: ‘Gorjechem’ tops at 6th Children’s Tiatr Festival |publisher=Heraldgoa.in |date=2015-12-29 |accessdate=2017-04-18}}</ref> and the Popular [[Tiatr]] Festival.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.navhindtimes.in/pai-emerges-victorious-at-tags-6th-popular-tiatr-festival/ |title='Pai' emerges victorious at TAG's 6th Popular Tiatr Festival |publisher=navhindtimes.in |date=2015-02-26 |accessdate=2017-04-18}}</ref> The Academy also organises jubilees of various [[tiatr]] actors.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.navhindtimes.in/india-post-releases-special-postal-cover-on-anthony-de-sa-on-his-birth-centenary/ |title=India Post releases Special Postal Cover on Anthony De Sa on his Birth Centenary |publisher=navhindtimes.in |date=2015-03-18 |accessdate=2017-04-18}}</ref> The Tiatr Academy of Goa organises workshops on [[tiatr]] in educational institutions across [[Goa]] to promote awareness about [[tiatr]] among the students.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.heraldgoa.in/Review/Tiatr-workshops-generate-more-enthusiasm-among-migrant-children/93242.html |title=Tiatr workshops generate more enthusiasm among migrant children |publisher=Heraldgoa.in |date=2015-09-06 |accessdate=2017-04-18}}</ref>
The Academy also has various schemes such as oral documentation of [[tiatr]], documentation of [[tiatr]] through research, etc.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tiatracademygoa.com/Three%20years%20Report%20of%20Activities%20of%20Tiatr%20Academy.pdf |title=Report of the Activities 06/01/2009 - 05/01/2012 |publisher=tiatracademygoa.com |date=2012 |accessdate=2017-04-18}}</ref> The Academy organise special programmes every month called ''Somplolea Tiatristancho Ugddas'' to remember the [[tiatr]] artists of yesteryears.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.navhindtimes.in/tag-to-remember-artistes-of-yesteryears/ |title=TAG to remember artistes of yesteryears |publisher= navhindtimes.in|date=2016-08-21 |accessdate=2017-04-18}}</ref> The Academy also organises a monthly programme where [[tiatr]] artists of repute are invited to interact with [[tiatr]] lovers.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.navhindtimes.in/edwin-dcosta-at-tags-meet-the-tiatr-artiste-programme/ |title=Edwin D'Costa at TAG's 'Meet the Tiatr Artiste' programme |publisher= navhindtimes.in|date=2015-02-18 |accessdate=2017-04-18}}</ref>
The Tiatr Academy of Goa has published several books regarding [[tiatr]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/et-cetera/tiatr-raises-its-curtains/articleshow/6258896.cms/ |title=Tiatr raises its curtains |publisher= http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/|date=2010-08-15 |accessdate=2017-04-18}}</ref> The Academy confers Lifetime Contribution Awards and ''Khell'' [[Tiatr]] Awards.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.daijiworld.com/news/newsDisplay.aspx?newsID=369838 |title=Tiatr Academy Goa institutes lifetime contribution awards |publisher= daijiworld.com|date=2015-11-25 |accessdate=2017-04-18}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/goa/Tiatr-Academy-Goas-khell-tiatr-awards/articleshow/16922645.cms |title=Tiatr Academy Goa's khell tiatr awards |publisher=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com|date=2012-10-23 |accessdate=2017-04-18}}</ref>
==List of Presidents of the Academy== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" style="font-size: 100%" |+List of Presidents of the Tiatr Academy of Goa ! scope="col" |S.No. ! scope="col" |Name ! scope="col" |From ! scope="col" |To |- | 1||[[Tomazinho Cardozo]]||January 6, 2009||March 15, 2012<ref>http://www.tiatracademygoa.com/President%20of%20Tiatr%20Academy%20of%20Goa1.html</ref> |- | 2||Prasad Lolayekar,<ref>http://www.tiatracademygoa.com/President%20of%20Tiatr%20Academy%20of%20Goa3.html</ref> Director, Directorate of Art & Culture, [[Government of Goa]] (Interim President)||March 16, 2012 ||July 29, 2012 |- | 3||[[Prince Jacob]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://englishnews.thegoan.net/story.php?id=252|title=The common man's prince|publisher=}}</ref>||July 30, 2012||September 3, 2015<ref>http://www.tiatracademygoa.com/President%20of%20Tiatr%20Academy%20of%20Goa2.html</ref> |- | 4||Agostinho Temudo<ref name="thegoan.net"/><ref>http://www.tiatracademygoa.com/President%20of%20Tiatr%20Academy%20of%20Goa5.html</ref>||September 4, 2015||till date |}
== References == <references />
[[Category:Theatre in India]] [[Category:Theatrical organisations in India]] [[Category:Tiatr]] [[Category:Culture of Goa]]

{{Infobox character | colour = <!-- headers background colour; the foreground colour is automatically computed --> | name = | series = <!-- use without the italic on the outside --> | image = TITAN (1).jpg | image_upright = | alt = | caption = Poster of the Titan the Robot | first = | last = | creator =Nik Fielding | portrayer = | voice = | lbl1 = | data1 = | lbl2 = | data2 = | lbl3 = | data3 = | info-hdr = | noinfo = | fullname =Titan the Robot | nickname =Titan | alias = | species = <!-- for non-humans only --> | gender = <!-- if not obvious --> | occupation = | affiliation = | title = | family = | spouse = | significantother = | children = | relatives = | religion = | nationality = | lbl21 =Height | data21 ={{convert|8|ft|m|}} | lbl22 =Weight | data22 ={{convert|60|kg|st|}} | lbl23 = | data23 = | extra-hdr = | lbl31 =Website | data31 =titantherobot.com | lbl32 = | data32 = | lbl33 = | data33 = }} {{Costume}} {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2017}}'''Titan the Robot''' (often referred to as '''Titan''') is the world's first large commercial entertainment robot (robot artist) developed by the British company Cyberstein.<ref name="times">{{cite web|url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/article1386725.ece|title=Wanted: replacement robot|date=2007-02-15|publisher=The Times|accessdate=2009-06-22}}</ref><ref name="cyberstein">{{cite web |url = http://www.cyberstein.co.uk/ |title = Cyberstein Robots Ltd. official site |accessdate = 2009-06-22 |publisher = Cyberstein |archive-url = http://webarchive.nationalarchives.gov.uk/20080906003623/http%3A//www.cyberstein.co.uk/# |archive-date = 6 September 2008 |dead-url = yes |df = dmy-all }}</ref> The robot is approximately 8 feet tall and weighs {{convert|60|kg|st|abbr=on}}<ref name="newsubstance">{{cite web|url=http://www.newsubstance-artists.co.uk/site/page_do--artist/artistID--59/CybersteinandTitan.html|title=Cyberstein and Titan|publisher=newsubstance-artists.co.uk|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060624051706/http://www.newsubstance-artists.co.uk/site/page_do--artist/artistID--59/CybersteinandTitan.html|archivedate=2006-06-24|accessdate=2009-06-22}}</ref> which increases to {{convert|350|kg|st|abbr=on}}<ref name="newsubstance" /> including the cart it rides on and onboard equipment. The face resembles a [[skull]], and some have even compared it to a [[Transformers|Transformer]].<ref name="times" /> Titan has performed at a variety of public and private events, such as the [[Commonwealth Games]], [[Bar Mitzvah]]s<ref name="newsubstance" /> UK shopping centres,<ref name="brewery">{{cite web |url = http://www.thebrewerycheltenham.co.uk/news/latest/Page10/ |title = TITAN the Robot makes his debut at the Brewery! |accessdate = 2009-06-22 |publisher = The Brewery, Cheltenham |archive-url = https://archive.is/20130421112307/http://www.thebrewerycheltenham.co.uk/news/latest/Page10/# |archive-date = 21 April 2013 |dead-url = yes |df = dmy-all }}</ref> television fundraisers and live concerts.<ref name="cyberstein" />Entered the Chinese market in 2018 and operated by Tuxuan Robotics.
==Operation== {{unreferenced section|date=July 2015}} The upper body of the robot is controlled by the operator through the operator panel. The upper part of the operator is located on the chest of the "robot", where a unidirectional transparent glass window is available for the operator to observe the situation ahead. The "robot" has a shoulder, arm and head that is higher than the actual performer's head (up to 8 feet in total). The part above the "robot" chest is a remote control mechanism. The operator in the body can manipulate the upper part of the "robot" through the control panel in the chest of the body to complete various instructions. The actions and sounds are pre-programmed and automatically triggered when the corresponding actions and commands are made. The robot can identify the interactive objects through the AI and automatically retrieve interactive interactive samples.
The lower body of the Titan robot is led by the operator. The active joint on the buttocks is wider than the actual actor. The purpose is to make the movement more mechanical. It explains why the Titan is so flexible and smooth, so that it is the most advanced in the industry. Robotic walking mechanisms (such as Petman in Boston, USA and Aisimo in Honda, Japan) are not comparable in terms of motion accuracy.
In addition, the body can also be controlled by an outside assistant, especially when the actor encounters a potential crisis that is unpredictable, the assistant who observes in the distance is taken over by the remote control. (For example, if a child appears in a visual blind zone, the assistant can take over the manipulation to avoid harming the surrounding people)
==Recent or notable performances==
=== 2010 === * '''9 March - [[ECHO Awards]] in [[Berlin]], Germany'''. Two versions of Titan performed with the international pop star, [[Rihanna]]. <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rap-up.com/2010/03/04/video-rihanna-makes-out-with-a-robot/|title=Video: Rihanna Makes Out with a Robot|date=2010-03-04|work=[[Rap-Up]]|accessdate=2010-03-18}}</ref> * '''27 March - [[2010 Kids' Choice Awards|Nickelodeon Kids' Choice Awards]].''' Titan also performed to a worldwide audience again with Rihanna. The Rihanna performances received much attention from the UK media, including [[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/showbiz/bizarre/usa/2879880/Rihanna-stuns-in-green-catsuit-at-Berlin-Echo-Awards.html|title=Rihanna at Berlin Echo Awards|date=March 6, 2010|work=www.thesun.co.uk|accessdate=2010-04-05}}</ref> and [[Heat magazine]]. * '''7–11 April - [[The Gadget Show|The Gadget Show Live]]'''. Titan was used for comedy purposes during the annual "''The Gadget Show'' Live Super Theatre" shows at the [[National Exhibition Centre|NEC]] in [[Birmingham]]. * '''20 September - [[Daybreak (2010 TV programme)|Daybreak]]'''. Titan appeared on 30 September on Daybreak's "Cool before School" feature. On 22 December it appeared again, playing a recording of "How much is that doggy in the window". '''2 December - [[JLS]]'''. Titan joined a 40-day tour with JLS, appearing on stage to the track "Superhero".
=== 2011 === * '''The Gadget Show'''. Cyberstein confirmed on [[Facebook]] page that Titan will be used in an episode of The Gadget Show 11th series. In photos it is believed that it is in a sketch with [[Suzi Perry]] and [[Jason Bradbury]] * '''15–17 April - The Gadget Show Live.''' Titan was also used at The Gadget Show live as a feature in the super theater. There were also two other titan robots that looked like the original. These were believed to be called Titan 2 and Titan 3. * '''10 November -''' '''Natholdet, Danish TV2.''' While in Denmark for the BEEP gadget expo, Titan visited the Danish late night talk show, Natholdet, where it was to pick the winner of a drawing contest. However, Titan struggled with taking its hand down in the bowl, as its hands were too big and was told to leave the stage after several attempts.
=== 2013 === * '''[[Germany's Next Topmodel]]''' Titan appeared on German Television ([[ProSieben|Pro7]]) for the show ''Germany's Next Topmodel'' 2013.
=== 2014 === * '''7 July''' - '''[[Big Brother (UK TV series)|Big Brother UK]]'''. Titan the robot appeared on the 11th series of Big Brother in the UK as part of a task. * '''21 August - [[Clacton-on-Sea|Clacton]] Air Show, [[Essex]]''' * '''21 August - The N1 Centre, [[Islington]]'''
=== 2015 === * '''8–10 January - [[BT Group|BT]] [[Young Scientist and Technology Exhibition]]'''<ref>{{cite web | title=Events at the BT Young Scientist Exhibition 2015 | url=http://www.btyoungscientist.ie/search/exhibition/schedules-special-acts | date=2015-01-11}}</ref>
=== 2017 === * '''31 October - 1 November - [[Microsoft]] Future Decoded''' * '''Butlins'''. Titan appears at all [[Butlins]] resorts in the UK. Titan arrives being carried on a mini mobility scooter and then puts on a performance in the magic circle after Dave turns him on.
=== 2018 === * '''15 July - [[Nissan]] Family Fun Day''' to celebrate 30 years of Nissan Technical Centre Europe *19 April F1 SHANG HAI CHINA *6 Nov China International Import Expo SHANG HAI CHINA *17 Nov [[The Royal Town of Sutton Coldfield]] Christmas lights, where Titan turned on the town's Christmas lights.
